meanings.definition: The main events of a play, novel, movie, or similar work, devised and presented by the writer as an interrelated sequence.
meanings.sent1: The plotlines of the story kept me engaged till the end.
meanings.sent2: She analyzed the plotlines of different books for her literature class.
meanings.sent3: The plotlines of the mystery novel had unexpected twists and turns.
meanings.sent4: The plotlines of the movie intertwined beautifully to create a captivating narrative.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plotlines of the TV series left viewers eagerly awaiting each new episode.

meanings.definition: A plan made in secret by a group of people to do something illegal or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The criminals devised intricate plotlines to carry out the heist.
meanings.sent2: The detectives uncovered the plotlines of the conspiracy during their investigation.
meanings.sent3: The plotlines of the scheme were foiled by a clever informant.
meanings.sent4: The plotlines of the criminal organization were finally exposed by undercover agents.
meanings.sent5: The intricate plotlines of the illegal operation unraveled under police scrutiny.
